title: TURNSTILE Announces Visual Album To Premiere At Tribeca Festival 2025
description: A companion to their upcoming record. The post TURNSTILE Announces Visual Album To Premiere At Tribeca Festival 2025 appeared first on Metal Injection.
author: Greg Kennelty
byline: By Greg Kennelty Published 5 hours ago
excerpt: A companion to their upcoming record.
text: If you've seen Turnstile's recent music videos and thought they looked pretty cinematic, you're right! Turnstile has just announced a 14-song visual album called Turnstile: Never Enough directed by Turnstile's own Brendan Yates and Pat McCrory, set to premiere New York's prestigious Tribeca Festival 2025. And no – it's not anything different than Turnstile's upcoming record Never Enough. It's just a counterpart to the record. Turnstile – now back to a five-piece of vocalist Brendan Yates, guitarists Pat McCrory and Meg Mills, bassist Franz Lyons, and drummer Daniel Fang – will release their first new record in four years Never Enough, due out June 6. Pre-orders are available here. You can also catch Turnstile at one of their festival appearances below. 5/10 Baltimore, MD Wyman Park Dell5/15 Los Angeles, CA Ukrainian Cultural Center6/6 Brooklyn, NY Under the K Bridge6/7 Barcelona, Spain Primavera Sound 20256/11 Athens, Greece Teatro Petras6/13 London, UK Outbreak Fest London 20256/14 Porto, Portugal Primavera Sound Porto 20256/18 Vienna, Austria Gasometer6/19 Prague, Czech Republic Velky Sal Lucerna6/21 Clisson, France Hellfest 20256/23 Esch-sur-Alzette, Luxembourg Rockhal6/25 Warsaw, Poland Letnia Scena Progresji6/27 Brussels, Belgium Ancienne Belgique6/28 Ysselsteyn, Netherlands Jera On Air 20256/29 Somerset, UK Glastonbury Festival 20257/12 Ottawa, Canada Ottawa Blues Festival 202510/3 Sacramento, CA Aftershock 202510/17–18 Miami, FL III Points 2025 Want More Metal? html:
If you've seen Turnstile's recent music videos and thought they looked pretty cinematic, you're right! Turnstile has just announced a 14-song visual album called Turnstile: Never Enough directed by Turnstile's own Brendan Yates and Pat McCrory, set to premiere New York's prestigious Tribeca Festival 2025. And no – it's not anything different than Turnstile's upcoming record Never Enough. It's just a counterpart to the record.

Turnstile – now back to a five-piece of vocalist Brendan Yates, guitarists Pat McCrory and Meg Mills, bassist Franz Lyons, and drummer Daniel Fang – will release their first new record in four years Never Enough, due out June 6. Pre-orders are available here. You can also catch Turnstile at one of their festival appearances below.
